Heritrix Expert User Group Forum - May 7, 2010, Singapore


The Internation=
al Internet Preservation Consortium (IIPC), The National Library & Archives=
 Singapore, and the Internet Archive will be hosting an Expert User Group F=
orum for Heritrix Operators and Developers on May 7, 2010 in Singapore.

Th=
e forum will feature a mix of detailed sessions on the H3 architecture, ope=
rator presentations, brainstorms, and sessions to identify and prioritize k=
ey areas of future development. A draft agenda is included below. 

The for=
um will be hosted from 9am-5pm. There is no charge to attend. 

We hope tha=
t some of you will be able to attend and will want to contribute by present=
ing use cases or by suggesting new/revised agenda topics. If you are able t=
o attend the meeting, please complete the survey located here: http://www.s=
urveymonkey.com/s/8CCYND7 .

Thanks!

The Heritrix Development Team


_____=
____________________

Heritrix Expert User/Deve=
loper Summit

Date: Friday, May 7, 2010

Times: 9am - 5pm





Agenda:

9am=
 - 9:30am Welcome & Meeting Logistics

Round robin intros and discussion of=
 what each attendee wants to get out of the session, revision of the agenda=
 to accommodate goals/objectives of the group


9:30am - 11am Heritrix v3 (=
H3) - a detailed presentation and open discussion of H3 architecture and AP=
I's


11am - 11:15am Break


11:15am-12:15pm Open Discussion of H3 continue=
s


12:15pm-1:15pm Lunch

1:15pm - 2pm Open Discussion: How to contribute t=
o the Heritrix project/What IA needs to include your code/How to become a c=
ommitter/Issues you've faced in incorporating your code


2pm-3pm Use Case =
Demos/Discussion #1: Planning for and Executing Focussed/Topic/Site Based H=
arvests


3pm-4pm Use Case Discussion #2: Infrastructure planning, performa=
nce, scalability, and automation


4pm - 4:15pm Break


4:15pm - 5pm Use Ca=
se Discussion #3: Planning for and Executing Large Scale Crawls (incl split=
ting crawls between multiple machines)



5pm Closing Discussions, Q&A, Wra=
p up and Prioritization of Next Steps
